subtitle: A delicious nutty orange caked filled with a rich chocolate cream.

method.text: Preheat oven to 190°C. Grease and line a Swiss roll tin 33x23 cm.

In a food processor, place the almonds, 25 g of the sugar and flour. Whizz until very fine. Tip mixture into a mixing bowl and slowly beat in the egg. In a grease-free bowl whisk up the egg whites. When stiff, whisk in remaining sugar. Fold this mixture into the almonds and spread evenly into the Swiss roll tin.
Bake for 15 min or until golden brown and spongy. Leave to cool.

Meanwhile, make the syrup: Boil the sugar and water together until sugar has dissolved. Add Grand Marnier. Make up the chocolate cream by scalding the cream, take off the heat and pour over the chocolate in a bowl. Beat the mixture until cold and smooth.

Divide cake into eight even rectangles. Place one rectangle onto a serving plate and brush with the syrup and little chocolate cream. Repeat with remaining layers, stacking layers to line up evenly. Chill well until firm.
Coat the outside with the remaining reheated chocolate cream, by pouring it over the cake. Leave to set and cut into slices.

title: Grand Marnier chocolate almond cake
